body: EducationÂ   Petroglyph National Monument creates curriculum-based programs that incorporate the monument's interpretive themes into your lesson plan. Themes include New Mexico's cultural and natural resources, the human history of Albuquerque, and the National Park Service. These interpretive themes are the building blocks which connect student's to the park's resources. Educational programs can be presented by a park ranger at the monument or in your classroom.   Call 505.899.0205 x332 for more info.
